page.title: 11VERNACULAR ARCH.SPETCHLEY
page.content: {LISTED BUILDINGS}This area is distinguished by the number of fine listed building which it contains. Examples of timber framed and early brick built vernacular architecture include: {Bredicot Court Farm}and cottages . Photographs of these date from 1852 when one of England's earliest photographers,{Benjamin Brecknell {Turner}took over 240 pictures,some of the village. {Churchill Wood Farm}and {dovecote. The house dates from c. 1660 and the dovecote may be much earlier. {Cobweb Cottage.}On the boundaries of our grid, in Churchill parish, this tiny thatched cottage was once one of many in a long street which stopped at Townsend farm.It stands alone today, surrounded by open fields.
